TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 591
TEI.2.document_title: John Davis Bradburn to J F Madero, 01-25-1831

barker_notes.barker_summary: Juan Davis Bradburn to José Francisco Madero, January 25, 1831. Telling Madero that his authority as State land commissioner conflicts with the law of April 6, 1830, and with article 4 of the national colonization law of August 18, 1824. (Omitted.)
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 591

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Juan Davis Bradburn to José Francisco Madero, January 25, 1831. Telling Madero that his authority as State land commissioner conflicts with the law of April 6, 1830, and with article 4 of the national colonization law of August 18, 1824. (Omitted.)*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Galveston Bay,*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="01-25-1831">January 25, 1831*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*See Calendar.*/p*
*/div1*
